item.title: Conditional nested blocks in Terraform
item.description: Here’s a useful technique for using Terraform’s dynamic blocks to create conditional nested blocks. Maintenance mode As an example, let’s create a “maintenance mode” for a service which allows a “under maintenance” holding page to be served when a Terraform variable is set. This is useful if you need to stop all traffic to a RDS database server so it can be upgraded. Define a boolean maintenance_mode variable: # variables.

item.title: Maintainable Terraform CIDR lists
item.description: Problem Your Terraform config requires managing many CIDRs that control firewall ingress rules. You’ve been storing these in a CSV string: variable "client_cidrs" { default="50.1.1.1/32,44.2.1.0/32", } which is fed to a aws_security_group somewhere in your configuration. The CIDRs change frequently and maintaining this variable is difficult as it’s hard to track where each individual CIDR came from.
